page.title: 07 Kestle Mill
page.content: Kestle Mill is situated about four miles from Newquay,on the main road between St. Austell and Newquay. We couldn't find out the meaning of the word Kestle, but there was a water mill in the centre of the village that was used until the 1950s.The mill was used to crush the grain from the farms around the area. We visited some of the people who lived in Kestle Mill.There are eight cottages in the lane.Most of the people have moved there in the last five years. They have modernised the old farmworkers' cottages. Some of the cottages are made of stone and others have cob walls. Mrs May was very interesting to talk to. She has lived there for 54 years. She showed us some old photographs including one of the Sunday School.
